Subjective: Dizziness for 3 days, started when waking up; feels like room is spinning; worse with head movement; accompanied by nausea, but no vomiting; no headache; no hearing loss or tinnitus; no speech difficulties; no loss of function in body; no heart palpitations, but heart can beat fast during episodes; scared it might be something serious like a brain tumor; wants to get rid of dizziness; impact on daily life: unable to do much due to dizziness; no smoking/alcohol/drugs; recent cold, but no prolonged bed rest.
Objective: BP 110/70; pulse 62/min; neurological examination: normal facial sensation, normal eye movements, no nystagmus; HIT test negative on both sides; Epley manoeuvre provoked symptoms, with movement in eye; no failure of entire body.
Assessment: Benign paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV); ruled out brain tumor.
Plan: Perform Epley manoeuvre in practice; provide instructions for self-performance at home via thuisarts.nl; follow-up as needed.
